title: PBSO: Man killed in suburban Boynton Beach from accidental gun shot
content:
A 21-year-old man died early Friday from an accidental self-inflicted gunshot outside a home west of the city, according to the Palm Beach County Sheriff’s Office.
Deputies found the man after responding to a home on the 7400 block of Michigan Isle Road in Lake Charleston, a 20-year-old neighborhood of large, single-family houses just south of Hypoluxo Road between Jog Road and Florida’s Turnpike. The shooting took place about 4:30 a.m.
PBSO released few details regarding the shooting or what led up to it. Reporters were able to see a man’s body surrounded by crime scene investigators lying in the backyard of a home on Michigan Isle Road.
The victim had not been identified Friday afternoon as detectives worked to reach his next of kin, according to PBSO.
Neighbors said they had heard noise from parties this week in the area of the shooting, but there was no word Friday on whether the man had attended any party in the area.
